_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Valspar Corporation (Valspar) personnel in Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin take great pride in maintaining a safe operation for the employees, the community, and the environment. The primary focus is to prevent accidental releases before they occur, while providing systems that minimize any release that does occur and contain it in as small as area as possible.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES: It is Valspar's policy to operate its plants in a manner that protect its employees, the public, and the environment. It is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.

FACILITY DESCRIPTION: The Valspar Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin facility is a warehouse for storage of architectural and industrial aerosol coatings.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS: The Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin Facility has implemented numerous safeguards including Operational Procedures and other accepted good engineering and industry practices. The facility uses both procedural as well as technological systems to ensure safe handling of the architectural and industrial aerosol coatings.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY: The Valspar Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin plant has never had an accident involving architectural and industrial aerosol coatings that resulted in injuries, property damage or environmental releases.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM: In the event of an emergency involving flammable propellants, plant personnel will notify the Menomonee Falls Fire Department and rely on their expertise to handle the situation. Members of the fire department have inspected the plant. In addition, Valspar has a contract with a qualified emergency response firm to aid in the cleanup of a release.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY: Valspar has an ongoing and continuing process to audit, update and review our processes for safety considerations. Valspar currently does not have any planned changes to further
